lines.text: I've got socks older than you.
[first lines]
I think it's time for you to get some help.
Why?
Because you can't do your job anymore.
Because I let that man live?
That man is the worst bastard that...

[interupting]
I don't care! I've had enough! I want out.
What am I supposed to tell our superiors at the company?
Tell them good bye.
You know too much. One of the first things you tought me is that nobody just walks away from the CIA.
Watch me.
Malone, or whoever the fuck you say you are, shut up!
When were you in Viet Nam?

[gives it some thought]
That was a little early, wasn't it?
Not for what I was supposed to do.
Mr. Malone, can I ask you a question? Are you a criminal?

[pauses]
I'm sure you could find some people who think so.
I'm Paul Barlow. This is my daughter, Jo.
Malone.
You got a first name?
Yeah.
I'm Sheriff Hawkins. I don't believe we've met.
We haven't.
I'm getting too old for this.
You're not too old.
You have no idea.
